description.narrative: Insatsen innebär en fortsättning av Kvinna till Kvinnas (KtK) långsiktiga arbete med kvinnoorganisationer i Georgien i syfte att stärka kvinnorörelsen i landet och därmed kvinnors röst och ökad jämställdhet. KtK arbetar både med kapacitetsutveckling av sina partner organisationer och med vidareförmedling av medel till dem. Strax över halva budgeten är avsatt för vidareförmedling av medel. Under programperioden kommer KtK att arbeta med totalt 12 organisationer varav 2 organisationer kommer att fasas ut under 2016. Tematiskt fokuserar KtK arbetet inom områdena för bekämpningen av könsrelaterat våld, kvinnors deltagande i fredsprocesserna, ökad kunskap om jämställdhet och kvinnors rättigheter och stärkt skydd för HBT-rättigheter och sexuella och reproduktiva rättigheter. Insatsen kommer att löpa över 5 år och omfattar utfasningen av KtK stöd vid programmets slut med fokus på partner organisationernas hållbarhet.

KtK support women's orgnisations in Georgia both through regranting of funds and through capacity building focusing on the area of gender based violence, peacebilding and strengthening LGBT-rights and sexual and reproductive health and rights. By strengthening it's partner organisations KtK aim to strengthen the women's movement in Georgia and thus women's voice in society.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

title.narrative: Grant Agreement between SIDA and Kvinna till Kvinna 2016
Beslut om insats - Kvinna till Kvinna 2016-2020

description.narrative: Th kvinna till Kvinna Foundation continues the progress towards the achievement of the set objectives. Progress 2018, key results per outcome include the following: 1) Kvinna till Kvinna Parner Organizations (POs) have contributed to the prevention of and protection against GBV - Enhanced legal framework for gender based violence prevention and response: National Action Plan for 2018-2020 on the Measures to be implemented for Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence and Protection Victims/Survivors was adopted. - PO, Anti-Violence Network of Georgia (AVNG), reports that number of cases that were successfully resolved as the result of the involvement of relevant state structures in a more coordinated manner and improved legislation. In 2018, 63% of cases were resolved. (In 2017, 65% of cases were resolved) - Number of partner organizations were included in policy and legal development; ex. PO, Women’s Initiatives Supporting Group (WISG), together with the Coalition for Equality developed a monitoring framework for certain sections of the Human Rights Action Plan, and recommendations for the upcoming Action Plan; AVNG was part of a Task Force initiated by the Legal Issues Committee in Parliament; Municipalities in the region asked the PO,Democrat Women’s Organisation of Samtskhe-Javakheti (DWO), to provide mobile medical services to the people in the rural villages of these districts. - 451 police officers and 100 social workers were trained in workshops, special attention was paid to the issue of effective implementation of legislation. - POs have increased the number of services provided, ex. 3159 women and children receiving legal support and consultations; 159 women and children were provided with shelter; 202 women and children received face-to-face social rehabilitation and consultation. 2) Kvinna till Kvinna and POs have improved women’s contribution to and participation in peacebuilding - In 2018, peace building efforts of POs mainly focused on local level confidence-building and activism. 14 Women’s Initiative Groups in Georgia with the support of POs submitted 49 proposals to local authorities, indicating a more coherent and solid work to empower women leaders and activists at the local level. - PO, DWO is working with Armenian and Georgian women. In 2018, they conducted research, which identified community priority issues to be advocated to the local government. Based on the 6 peace building meetings, attended by 210 women, 8 community petitions were put forth by the women and 5 of them were resolved positively by the local government - Three POs participated in the cross-regional networking meeting on peace building (Sweden) Two meetings in third country between AWA and FS to develop their cooperation and peace building work. - POs participated in the gender-sensitive mediation training (Armenia) 3) Kvinna till Kvinna and POs have contributed to increased awareness of gender equality and women’s rights, improved protection of LBT rights and SRHR, and a more pluralistic civil society - National Action Plan for 2018-2020 on the Measures to be implemented for Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence and Protection Victims/Survivors was adopted and partners contributed for it to be adopted. - Peace building networking and exchange between partners from Armenia, Azerbaijan and Bosnia and Herzegovina 4) Cross cutting: Kvinna till Kvinna has contributed to POs increased organisational and institutional sustainability - The mid-term review included also an organisational assessment. the Review presented the key findings and conclusions for four pillars of the Kvinna till Kvinna programme, which are as following: 1)Gender-based Violence - The Review concludes, that Kvinna till Kvinna partners are delivering high quality and highly relevant services to women and children affected by violence. 2) Women, Peace, and Security, the Review assesses that partner organizations (POs) deliver diverse activities, which aim to enhance relations between ethnic groups, strengthen integrated human security or establish online communication between communities divided by “borderisation”. 3)Women’s rights, movement and advocacy - the Review concludes that POs provide highly needed services, that allow women and girls to access their rights, which respond to the needs of conflict affected, rural, and LBT women and are able to demonstrate good practice to the duty bearers who should finallytake ownership of these services. Kvinna till Kvinna and POs demonstrate substantial record of achievement across many levels, including welfare, policy level changes and public awareness and perception. Most importantly, women are increasingly able to voice the concerns on he issues which affect them. 4) Organisational and Institutional Development - the Review concludes that all POs are highly satisfied with the support and training provided by KtK and are eager to receive more. However, POs show mixed progress in terms of organisational and institutional development. While all POs have received a wide range of direct capacity building and exposure and study visits, only some POs demonstrate a strong commitment to strategic planning and organisational change and some POs are reluctant in taking full ownership for their organizational development. The Kvinna till Kvinna continues to follow up on the recommendations of the mid term review, including the update of the results assessment framework (RAF), which has made the RAF more realistic and adapted to the reality. The changes to the RAF don't impact the impact level, nor the outcome and serve to improve the outputs. - Annual Review Meeting was held on May 30, 2019 between the Embassy and the Kvinna till Kvinna Programme for Georgia and the Breakaway Regions. During the meeting, the 2018 narrative and financial report,as well as possibility of additional funds to bring the program closer to its original agreed sum was discussed. The Embassy was also informed on internal management changes in Kvinna till Kvinna Georgia program. - Additional funds for 2019-2020, on December 17th 2019, the Embassy and the Kvinna till Kvinna Foundation have agreed on the amendment of the agreement in order to add 3 000 000 SEK to the program, as well as approved updated budget and workplan for 2019. Unexpected results have been impact of the decentralization process at the Kvinna till Kvinna Foundation in general and internal staff turnover at the local office, as well the move to the new office in Tbilisi, due to the tenant's increased office cost.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
